DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Margin Frozen Section Diagnosis Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of frozen section margins, related to location and distance.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the rapid diagnosis that uses a frozen tissue sample, rather than a chemically fixed sample, to taken from the edge or border of the tissue removed in cancer surgery to determine the surgical border is free of cancer cells.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The edge or border of the tissue removed in cancer surgery.  The margin is described as negative or clean when the pathologist finds no cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has been removed.  The margin is described as positive or involved when the pathologist finds cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has not been removed.

Concepts.definition: One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.
A method for rapid diagnosis that uses a frozen tissue sample rather than a chemically fixed sample.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of frozen section margins, related to location and distance.

PermissibleValues.value: Negative less than 3 mm mucosal frozen section margin
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Negative Less Than Three Millimeter Mucosa Frozen Section Margin

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Negative Less Than Three Millimeter Mucosa Frozen Section Margin
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Negative; involving disadvantage or harm.: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.: Mucous membrane.: A thin slice of tissue cut from a frozen specimen, often used for rapid microscopic diagnosis.: Margin; the boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary.
